text: I think what we do is pretty ridiculous
so I don't expect anybody to really get
it when they first see it the media
attention is pretty intense because it's
our first year that we're going to be in
the Olympics but people don't understand
that I am NOT a snowboarder most people
think that we snowboard when I tell
people I ski half-pipe their second
question is always oh okay so you're a
snowboarder then that is in fact not
true I think people often think that
free skiers are on really short skis
because it'll make it easier to do
tricks but longer skis and stiffer skis
allow you to go bigger and they give you
a more stable base to land in the past
it's been the smaller kind of stockier
guys are more able to to flip their body
around easier but now there's people
like Bobby Brown he's a big guy and he's
on top and he's fully capable of doing
everything a little guy can do in the
beginning it was heavily heavily
influenced by snowboarding but over the
years i think we've grown up as a sport
and kind of developed our own thing
that's why i think i'm so excited about
having our sport in the olympics because
i think people will finally understand
that you can actually ski in a halfpipe
the grabbing the skis i think is a hard
for people to understand like why when
you grab your skis it puts your body in
a certain position and it makes a trick
look a certain way it comes down to a
style it's not as uniform and regimented
and standardized as a lot of the Olympic
sports it's completely free and creative
and you can kind of figure out your own
flow and your own type of tricks the
course is your canvas and your skis are
your paintbrush
you
